title: [Phase1] Implement logos ls command
description: Enumerate .md files under sessions/ and display a human-readable table. Options: --tag <tag>, --since <date>, --json (structured JSON output with frontmatter + excerpt, for agent consumption).

title: [Phase2] Implement logos setup command
description: logos setup claude: append logos reference line to CLAUDE.md. logos setup cursor: append to .cursor/rules. logos setup aider: append to .aider.conf.yml. Distinction from init: init initializes .logosyncx/ itself, setup integrates with agent config files.

title: [Phase2] Implement privacy filter
description: During logos save, detect patterns matching privacy.filter_patterns in config.json (API keys, personal info, etc.) and warn/mask them. Provide a set of default regex patterns out of the box.

title: [Phase1] Implement logos save command
description: Accept .md input via --file <path> or --stdin. Auto-fill frontmatter id/date if not present. Save to .logosyncx/sessions/ as <date>_<topic>.md. Auto-run git add via go-git. git commit/push is the user's responsibility. No interactive prompts (non-interactive use by agents).

title: Implement config.json read/write
description: Load and save .logosyncx/config.json. Fields: version, project, agents_file, save.summary_sections, privacy.filter_patterns. Fill in default values when config does not exist.

title: Go project initial setup
description: go mod init, add cobra/go-git/goldmark/yaml.v3 dependencies, create cmd/ pkg/ internal/ directory structure. Binary name is logos.

title: [Phase1] Implement logos init command
description: Generate .logosyncx/ directory, config.json, USAGE.md, and template.md. Append 'Use logos CLI...' line to AGENTS.md (or CLAUDE.md). Show an error message if already initialized.

title: [Phase2] Implement logos sync command
description: Scan sessions/ and rebuild the index. Warn if old sessions exist that are missing sections listed in summary_sections, or when .md files were manually added.

title: [Phase3] Implement MCP server (fallback)
description: MCP server for environments without shell access (e.g. Claude Desktop). Provides tools equivalent to logos ls / logos refer / logos search. Design note: agents with shell access should use the CLI; MCP is a supplementary fallback.

title: [Phase2] Implement logos status command
description: Display unsaved/uncommitted session information. Integrate with git status to list newly added or modified files under .logosyncx/sessions/.

title: [Phase1] Implement logos refer command
description: Search for a .md file by session name (exact or partial match) and print its content. --summary flag returns only sections listed in config's summary_sections (saves tokens). Show a list of candidates when multiple matches exist.

title: Implement session data model and file I/O
description: Read/write Markdown session files with frontmatter (id/date/topic/tags/agent/related). Parse frontmatter with goldmark + yaml.v3. Extract excerpt logic (first 200-300 characters of the Summary section).

title: [Phase2] Interactive UI for logos ls (fzf-style)
description: Interactive session list and filtering UI using bubbletea. Launches when logos ls is run without arguments. Falls back to standard non-interactive output when --json or --tag flags are provided.

title: [Phase1] Implement logos search command
description: Case-insensitive keyword match against topic, tags, and excerpt. Combinable with --tag flag. Primarily a human-facing helper command. Semantic search is handled by the agent itself via ls --json, so simple string matching is sufficient here.

title: [Phase3] Session cross-linking and dependency view
description: Visualize the session reference graph based on the related field in frontmatter. Display a list of related sessions when running logos refer.

title: [Phase3] Auto-update knowledge/ directory
description: On logos save or logos sync, automatically extract and update architecture.md / decisions.md / conventions.md from session files. Design the extraction using rule-based logic without calling an LLM (e.g. append Key Decisions sections to decisions.md).
